reviews.review_msg: Watch the videos from this guy called Jim Kurose, he has an entire playlist that is better than going to any lecture. No need to go to class if you want to learn. Although the prof seemed nice, the lectures just aren't good.
worst professor ever, just wants you to memorize stuff and then proceeds to not support the tutorial times that he set up

Entire class is practically just plagiarized from Jim Kurose, including all the slides. Homework assignments are all copy/pasted from other schools or textbooks. Exams are the same and contain content that has not been covered in class.

One of the laziest professors at SFU. Course materials patched from different schools, labs are blindly copy and pasting, no reasoning given for docked marks on exams/assignments, TAs ghost when asking for assignment feedback, exams contain material that were barely or not covered at all. Don't recommend.

Laziest prof I've ever encountered. His lectures are useless, he doesn't respond to emails, and his exams are so unrealistic given what he "covers" in class (this is true even if you do the readings).

What a brutal experience. Bob Gill is a great example of someone who puts no effort in. Don't take this class with him. I fully expect the final to be full of questions that were never taught just like the midterm. Sad.

No effort put into anything. Midterms cover topics not mentioned in slides or book. His lectures are not worth attending, and he makes passive aggressive comments about people not attending. Labs are "type the thing into terminal, report what you see". Assignments are just basic math, except with a networking theme, not actual networking problems.

Another student who's fair review was removed. To reiterate: he is the worst kind of professor. There is next to no effort put into student's learning and many midterms topics are never taught. Look at past midterms to do well, idk about the final. Don't go to class unless you are very passionate about the material.

It seems like the professor is reviewing all of them because my last review got removed. Shame. TL;DR: don't take this class if you actually want to learn, homework is copied from other schools, exams cover topics that haven't been taught, lectures go off topic a lot. At least he's funny though.

Well it seems that the prof or someone else is reporting all negative ratings on the site. All negative ratings were 'reviewed'. My rating was removed for no reason. Seems like RMP hurts his ego or something. He should take that effort and put it towards being a better prof.

I appreciate his funny storytelling, but he has a hard time lecturing about relevant course material, making it tough to actually learn. His exams and assignments are confusing and difficult. I would wait for a better prof if you want to take the course.
Wonderful prof. Nothing wrong with him at all!

One of few teachers who used Industry examples relating to course material. This made learning better. One can see applications in daily life to understand better. Thanks - may be see you in 471. Wireshark learning was great.

Bob is knowledgeable in his field. He often jokes about his experiences, but oftentimes forgets that talking about something isn't teaching it. He often glosses over very important concepts and goes on side rambles, making it hard to know what we actually need to understand. Self learning (Jim Kurose YT videos) are more helpful than Bob's lectures.
Professor Gill is truly one of the nicest professors at SFU, he genuinely cares about his students well being. His practical examples make his classes very interesting and easy to follow.

While attendance is not mandatory but If you want to learn applications to industry yo should attend his lectures. Booking knowledge is not enough. Nice Video from AlcaTel Lucent - Dr. Gill. Made additional time to teach - Thank you. some students like me.

He related Industry application to this Math Heavy course and makes sense. My car radio is a demodulator - Hmmmm I see and now I know why some equipment costs more and sounds and performs better. Looking forward to working with you. Math is mind-numbing but seeing the output is brilliant.
Nice prof and great project - didn't know about AppDesigb=ner - Nice kit for project. I learnt practical things. Thank you Prof

Puts in no effort for this class and doesn't give a damn. Homework and exams are all copy pasted from elsewhere. Doesn't even update date in PDF headers. All exams contains questions on subjects that were not taught. What is taught is half useless due to weird focus on construction and city bylaws which are irrelevant for SFU engineering.
Bob is a great prof for this course. One of the easiest courses I've taken at SFU

Bob is a chill prof. It's ensc204, you draw a couple of things and you get an easy pass. idk how you fail the class but according to Bob a student did that twice lol. Legit the only way to fail is if you ghost the class or can't draw straight lines for your life.
Good teacher

I was familiar with Project Management but Bob's lectures really prepared me for a layout plan for a startup company. Benefit-Cost Ratio, Critical path and Economic Analysis was of your company is a great skill to have. Bob Brough Guest Speakers to talk about real-life projects and their management was excellent.

Bob consistently fails to meet even the basic requirements of teaching a course. Every week he was late posting the assignment. The marking for the assignments was opaque and unclear. Oftentimes questions were so poorly worded it was impossible to interpret what was being asked, and when emailed for clarification he says he "doesn't help students".

He managed to make an incredibly boring class about the business and ethics of engineering an actual enjoyable course. His vast knowledge from working at multiple big names in the industry and his very approachable and upbeat attitude makes him a fantastic prof. His experience also allows him to give personal examples; which is rare in the program.
Bob Gill is a very nice professor, though his lectures aren't as good as they could be. He's very friendly and is willing to help his students.

Most of his lecture didnt add much to the lecture notes if you took time to look through them yourself but it was his spirit and passion for what he teaches that kept me coming to his lectures! A genuinely nice and super easygoing person that obviously had a ton of experience/knowledge about the topic he was teaching. Love him!!

He's a nice guy but... Feels like about 50% of lecture is wasted on tangents and telling the same anecdotes repeatedly. PowerPoint jockey, glacial pace. Doesn't take time to understand student questions - just answers what he thinks is being asked. Misleading analogies. Avoid if you want to learn, but not the worst if you just need the credit.
